#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <ctype.h>

int main() {

    // Read s and t
    char s[1000], t[1000];
    fgets(s, sizeof(s), stdin);
    fgets(t, sizeof(t), stdin);

    // Remove newlines from the end of the strings
    s[strcspn(s, "\n")] = 0;
    t[strcspn(t, "\n")] = 0;

    // Compute frequencies for s and t
    int freqs[256] = {0};
    int freqt[256] = {0};

    for (int i =0; s[i]; i++) {
        freqs[s[i]]++;
    }
    for (int i =0; t[i]; i++) {
        freqt[t[i]]++;
    }

    // Compute yay
    int yay =0;
    for (int c =0; c <256; c++) {
        int min_val = freqs[c] < freqt[c] ? freqs[c] : freqt[c];
        yay += min_val;
        freqs[c] -= min_val;
        freqt[c] -= min_val;
    }

    // Compute whoops
    int whoops =0;
    for (int c =0; c <256; c++) {
        if (freqs[c] ==0) continue;
        if (islower(c)) {
            int other = c - 'a' + 'A'; // uppercase
            int min_val = freqs[c] < freqt[other] ? freqs[c] : freqt[other];
            whoops += min_val;
            freqs[c] -= min_val;
            freqt[other] -= min_val;
        } else if (isupper(c)) {
            int other = c - 'A' + 'a'; // lowercase
            int min_val = freqs[c] < freqt[other] ? freqs[c] : freqt[other];
            whoops += min_val;
            freqs[c] -= min_val;
            freqt[other] -= min_val;
        }
    }

    // Now compute a and b for second part
    int a = yay;
    double b_val = (double) whoops * 100.0 + 0.1;
    int b = (int) b_val;
    int n = (a * b) / 100;

    // Now build the li array for third part
    int li[1002];
    int index =0;

    for (int i=1; i <=370; i++) {
        int count =0;
        int temp_i =i;
        while (temp_i !=0) {
            temp_i /=10;
            count++;
        }
        if (count ==1) {
            li[index++] =i;
        } else {
            int temp[4];
            int temp_count =0;
            int q =i;
            while (q !=0) {
                temp[temp_count++] = q%10;
                q /=10;
            }
            // add in reverse order (original digits)
            for (int j = temp_count-1; j >=0; j--) {
                li[index++] = temp[j];
            }
        }
    }

    // Pop last two elements (so index is now index-2)
    index -=2;

    // Now, output li[n-1]
    printf("%d\n", li[n-1]);

    return 0;
}
